reviewText: Love the Movie!!! It comes with all three movies in Digital HD with lots of Bonus features on each disc plus it came with a whole disc of bonus features which is awesome. Also comes with a unique code so you can have the digital version so you can watch it online anywhere.  Very happy with the purchase:)
A must buy!!

Just got it today, I preordered it and it came in a entirely made from cardboard packaging which I never like to see. But I look forward to seeing the new bonus footage that came with it and there's a short film as well. All in all its not that bad (could be worse)

Excellent time travel series that set a standard for good science fiction, that nobody has had any luck coming near.

Most Sci Fi movies, especially movies related to time travel, beat you over the head the whole movie with the Science of how something is happening in the movie, while sacrificing the story.  Back To the Future has one of the best stories ever created and Michael Jay Fox, and Christopher Lloyd made the characters their own.  A remake would just never be possible because no actor, no matter how brilliant, would be able to replace either of them.

I don't really know what special features are included in this edition but it does have a complete video quality overhaul which is more than enough.  I encourage anybody and everybody to see this trilogy at least once and feel the magic that was this series.  It is fun all the way from the beginning until the credits roll after part 3.

My only complaint is that it should have included a free hoverboard....... I WANT A HOVERBOARD!!!!
Love the series wish they would make a 3d anniversary edition

Love this movie!

This is the greatest trilogy of all time.  Emphasis on time.

I remember watching these movies when they first came out, and they're just as phenomenal now as they were then.  Even after 30+ years into the FUTURE!

Picture quality is better than I ever saw them in the past.  Lea Thompson is smokin' hot (not quite as much as her role in Howard the Duck, something about that frizzy 80's hairdo and her being lead center in a female rock band.)

Fun fact:  When you watch the ending of the third one, pay close attention to the kid playing "Verne" on the train.  He sneaked in an "Easter Egg" that they didn't find out until after releasing the movie - and it's in this release.  I won't spoil it for you, but that's what google and YouTube is for.

Just wanted to make a quick remark regarding the digital copies not being redeemable. I bought mine July 2018 and entered all 3 codes and they worked just fine. I seen some reviews stating the digital copies were not working for one reason or another. Make sure you are going to Universaldigitalcopy.com

Movies are fantastic, and the bonus features and Blue Ray make the trilogy package worth it.

Dinging one star for the download capability.  When you "download" you load it onto your Movies Anywhere account, where it lives in the cloud.  This means it is not a local copy like an mp4 or something, only one you can stream when you have network access.  So you cannot watch on a plane or in the car or anywhere you don't have reliable network access.  "Movies Anywhere" is a bit misleading, eh?

Au update on my one star review:  The problems I had with the apparently mismarked disks was due to a software quirk in the VLC media player on two computers with different operating systems.  The problems of missing or otherwise faulty sets others reported here had me convinced that the local big box store had received a bad batch.  The tech help at the big box store showed me the error.  My apologies to anyone misled by my earlier review.

You can read all sorts of great reviews on the Back To The Future trilogy, and everyone who has seen them, whether recently, or grew up watching them like me will say that seeing these movies really are something any movie-goer will appreciate. As one of the die-hard fans, thought I'd post a review on the blu-ray collection, not to say how great it is, but give more of a run down of what to expect. There are more vintage featurettes than updated interviews, but the six part documentary is scattered between the three discs. By far, the best interview of the whole thing is the breakdown of science of time travel. It's a time travel take at it's finest, and really hasn't had any other movie match it's blockbuster power.

Brilliant movies that have stood the test of time. I had never seen any of the movies until I bought this set. I was encouraged to buy the trilogy after hearing the Popcorn podcast with Jack Ferry and Mitchel Davis.

The first movie is a classic that I could watch over and over just for the satisfaction of the story and how well it was conveyed by the actors and director. This movie set the tone for other movies that followed it.

The second movie is where it gets totally crazy and amazing. The second movie continually references the first movie and calls back tons of great gags from the first one. I can watch this movie over and over again, only to discover new things that I didn't see the first time. It is incredible how many layers this movie has. It was interesting though, they started this movie using the same ending footage of the first one, AND they gave you basically a free preview of the third one.

The third one is good but lacks the pizzaz that the second one had. It was a little disappointing, but it still kept me on the edge of my seat.

All around great movies that anyone can enjoy. With the blu-ray disc set, these movies are gonna be timeless and I will show my grandkids these movies. 10/10 Popcorns!! Would watch again!

The bluesy/HD transfer is amazing. And you can really see the makeup on Christopher Lloyd's face!

And the sound! So clear! I never thought a bluray could be so much better than a DVD and most aren't but they did a great job with this one.

Wow, I cannot say enough about what a superb job Universal has done on this classic movie trilogy. This is the review for the 30th Anniversary Limited Edition Steelbook Target exclusive with the "Bonus Disc" specifically for the 30th. Now, we all know the previous Edition that came out was the 25th Anniversary and had the foldout boxset with slipcover. The same movie blurays are in this set with same awesome extras on each disc.
It is exact, but I am satisfied with it because the blurays look outstanding on the UHD 4K TV and Sony upscaling bluray player. The res is 2160p!
So, no real need to go into the extreme details of all the previous extras, only that they are there from the 25th set. If you do not own that set, you may want to get this one. There are some really good extra features on the Bonus 4th Disc included here.
** BONUS DISC SPECIAL FEATURES **
~ 2015 Message from Doc Brown
~ Doc Brown Saves The World
~ Outatime: Restoring The DeLorean -This is a fantastic feature and shows what an undertaking a group of BTTF enthusiasts went through to take the car that was in the movies and restore it to all it's glory! The DeLorean now rests in a showcase at Universal Studios, Ca. where tourists can view the car and take pics with it, etc. Beautiful job!
~ Looking Back To The Future: A 45 minute documentary on various aspects of making the movies...
The Script, Casting Marty McFly, Christopher Lloyd reflects on Doc Brown, The DeLorean Time Machine, Building Hill Valley, Prepping for the Johnny B. Goode Scene, The Score
~ Back To The Future: The Animated Series
~ 2015 Commercials
I got mine much less than what is offered here, but if you are lucky enough, do some research and looking around at used Book/DVD/Bluray places.

I absolutely love these films! When I was in my middle school years, I hated these films. I thought they were boring, and they didn't do much for my imagination. I saw that Netflix had put them up, so I decided I was going to watch them. Fell in love. When Netflix decided to take them down about 3 or 4 months after they added them, I was very upset. I wanted to watch them so badly when I was still pregnant with my now 2 month old daughter, but couldn't. So, I decided to see if Amazon had the Blu Ray discs, and my husband just recently bought the 30th Anniversary Edition for my for Christmas. I now love these movies. I will forever cherish these movies, and introduce them to my daughter in a few short months. 5 star rating from this BTTF fan!

I purchased this item because it states that the DVD regions are A/B/C, which includes the United States. The Blu-ray DVDs play just fine on my US formatted Blu-ray player. The problem is that the digital copies cannot be redeemed in the US. Potential buyers should be aware that the digital copies available on this product can only be redeemed if you live in the United Kingdom. They cannot be redeemed in the United States.

Great Scott! I still remember first seeing BTTF part 1 for the first time when I was 8 on VHS (ah, the glorious 80's). After I finished watching the movie it instantly became my favorite movie and till this day it's still my favorite movie. The entire trilogy is my favorite trilogy, and even though I own them on DVD in various versions I will still watch them on TV. There is just something very magical about the bond between Marty Mcfly and Doc that has me glued to the screen.

The entire trilogy has something for everyone in my opinion. Time travel, romance, humor, Biff Tannen who I love to hate, great sets, and just an overall feel good factor. It's a timeless series, and even though we're now in 2016 I still very much get a kick out of the 2015 that was picturized in BTTF 2. There will never be anyone that can replace Michael J. Fox as Marty McFly. I was so happy to watch these 3 movies on the big screen on Back To the Future day.

I loved all of the bonus features on this DVD set (especially the making of the movies), and I will probably buy every DVD of the trilogy even if the bonus features don't change. :-) So, why don't you make like a tree and get out of here and get this DVD set? You know it's your density...I mean destiny to get it. And don't forget, if you put your mind to it you can accomplish anything.

Love the trilogy!!! It is fun to own all the three Back to the Future movies as a trilogy. The last time I watched some of them were in the theater, and the DVD's reminded me why I liked them so much. I love the beautiful detailed sets, the dramatic score with a full orchestra and the light hearted, simplified time travelling universe created by Robert Zemeckis and Bob Gales (not mention the fully committed performances by Michael J. Fox, Christopher Lloyd and Thomas Wilson, as Marty McFly, Doc Brown and Biff Tanner, respectively).

I am giving the set 4 stars because it comes with 2 bonus disks with terrible extra features that make you feel like you need a time machine so you can warn yourself not to them. These extras include the transcript of an interview with Bob Gales and Robert Zemekis concerning frequently asked questions. I admit the content was interesting, but having monochrome text that you have to scroll through with your DVD remote seems a little bit like using a cellphone as paper weight.

They also include an episode of the shortlived BTTF cartoon, and a terrible "update" to the movie where Doc Brown gives half baked explanations as to why inventions in the movies don't actually exist in 2015. (Basically, he went forward in the future and learned that they all have terrible repercussions so he now has to go back and time and prevent them from being invented.) This extra was a lame, unnecessary and inconsistent clip that looks like it was thrown together in an afternoon and filmed in a storage unit (all the more glaring when compared to Zemeckis meticulously detailed sets). Also, it is an apology for an admirable portrayal of 2015 which includes accurately portraying Google glass, Skype, social media, thumb print scanners, a dog drone walker, and even Katie Perry's 2015 Superbowl sharks.

Well, after too much Internet gossip and anticipation, we can finally enjoy the DVD version of this great trilogy. Actually, nothing needs to be said about the story or the fantastic crew that made it happen, everybody knows it (and if not, you're a caveman amongst other cavemenor cave-women). The DVDs have many extras you'll enjoy and then some
Probably the most-talked about issue of this release is the product's interpretation of the soft matted original cut. If you dig deep enough in Internet sources, you'll read a mixture of positive and negative responses. Fact is, on this 1.85:1 version, you will see less picture information in height, and more in width than the 4:3 version. This movie was shot in soft-matted format, which basically means that the original prints were in a kind of '4:3' format, where in the upper and lower regions there is information that needs to be covered (the microfone syndrome), and was not intended to be part of the screening of the film. One of my first DVD purchases years and years ago, was a BTTF DVD Box Set. I've always loved these films and wanted to own them. Of course, this set was plagued by the Framing Fiasco, where whoever created the discs used horrible transfers. I only found out about the fix (mailing in the discs for replacements) years after the fix ended. I had too much sentimentality over that original box set I spent way too much of my college money on, so I never replaced it.

Until I saw a good deal on the 30th Anniversary Blu-rays. I assumed they would have learned and get the transfers right, but I'm having a lot of trouble actually playing the Blu-Rays. I put them into my PS3 (which plays other discs just fine) and the disc just spins and spins and doesn't load. It took me at least a dozen tries (and sometimes more than a day) to get the disc to play. I waited too long to watch them and see if it was a problem that persisted or was a one off, and now I can't return this set (again).

I mean you would think that for a new 30th anniversary the sound quality would be boosted to a new 6.1 or 7.1 mix
just like Lucas did for his Star wars Blu-ray which is 6.1 master audio mix for all 6 episodes
Universal did it for Jaws and added a 7.1 master audio mix for the Blu-ray version
which sounds incredible by the way
but Universal did not bother making that much effort with the back to future series
most of the content on this new 30th anniversary edition is from the 25th Anniversary edition, nearly all of it actually
the setup for the extras is the exact same way as the 25th Anniversary edition
Disc 1 has the feature film plus the Tales from the Future featurettes
plus the archive featurettes from the special edition dvd versions, plus the Deleted scenes, outtakes etc
every extra from the 25th anniversary has been carried over
Disc 2 & 3 have the exact same setup
Disc 4 is the Bonus Disc with the new retrospective Documentary
which is not new at all, apparently this retrospective Doco called
LOOKING BACK TO THE FUTURE was filmed back in 2009 so it's Definitely not new
it must've been a TV broadcast special or somethin'
obviously universal felt the need to add something as a new extra for their 30th anniversary release
there's a featurette on restoring the Delorean called OUTTATIME again not a new featurette
it was filmed back in 2012
DOC BROWN SAVES THE WORLD which Christopher Lloyd talks about the Gadgets
from the series and explains why they don't exist in 2015, pointless waste of time featurette I think
and you get 2 episodes from the back to the future Animated series
that's about it for this Bonus Disc

the U.S. 30th Blu-ray version is foldout case Digi-pak, the U.K. version is a thick Blu-ray case with Disc trays inside it
both versions are all regions so all you have to do is choose which packaging you like best
if you have the 25th anniversary Blu-ray trilogy, not sure if this new 30th anniversary is worth buying
the only Difference is the Bonus Disc with the LOOKING BACK TO THE FUTURE TV special
2-3stars for this new 30th Anniversary Blu-ray, if your not fussy about the 4th Disc
just keep your 25th Anniversary Blu-ray edition of the series
Watched "Back to the Future" again. All I'm saying is, Marty McFly should have known he was going to get Parkinson's, time traveling that much.
Excellent movies. Classic!
Love it!!

This specific BluRay release is exactly the same as the standalone boxset available anywhere.  The only thing exclusive to this is a replica BTTF license plate.  It's made of metal(which was a nice surprise, i thought it'd be plastic!), and there are spaces where you can attach/screw the plate to a surface.  Just be aware that it's in 'mini' size and is nowhere close to the dimensions of a real license plate.

Still it's a nice and pretty unique extra to have with your BTTF boxset.  The packaging of the blurays themselves is in a normal paper/mediabook style packaging, which can't ever really close(unlike a regular Bluray case or even a steelbook). I'd still recommend this over the limited edition 'flux capacitor' box set.  :)
Love it!! This set has more bonus features than I read in the description! :D Awesome! I already loved the trilogy and now I own the 30th anniversary.

This is a reveiw of the 30th anniversary bluray box set i brought the steel book edition at target and the case doesnt have the dumb cardboard holder like the bluray box set has it cost me 30 bucks also as far as the discs its the same bluray discs as the 25th anniversary they even change the art work on the discs this set only has a 4th bluray which sucks the features aren't even in hi def if you own the 25th box set don't waste your money on this don't support universal home video they one of the worse video companies ever.
If you, or someone you know, doesn't like Back to the Future, you're in the wrong part of Amazon

Like the title says, this is specifically for the Target store exclusive steelbook edition of the 30th anniversary release.
You still get the four discs, with each movie taking up one bluray each, and the last disc is devoted to the extras disc(where the "Doc Brown Saves The World" short mini movie/episode is).  If you were not happy with the limited edition flux capacitor boxset quality or don't want the 'mediabook' style release of the normal 30th anniv. release, then the steelbook is perfect. The discs are housed in a sturdy steelbook, and the cover artwork of the Delorean is awesome. Definitely recommended to BTTD fan(atics).  :)

I own the previous blu-ray collection relased in 2010.  These 30th Anniversary discs are identical to the 25th Anniversary Collection in every way.  The actual discs are silver and blue and even have the year 2010 printed on them.  These have not been given any new film transfers.  The very few extras added to the new bonus disc in 2015 aren't essential and do not warrant a re-purchase unless you are an absolute completist and must have the new cover art.  This was only released to correspond with and capitalize on the date of October 21st, 2015.  I love the trilogy so I can can't give less than 5 stars in any configuration.  Only buy this if you've never owned the 25th anniversary edition.

Classic Trilogy.  The first one is by far the best, just a nearly perfect script, Crispin Glover's performance as Geroge McFly.  It's funny, it's touching, it's suspenseful.  Love it.  The 2 sequels are a lot of fun and add some twists, but are also pretty significant copies of the first one, but still great movies.

This is a very shameful cash grab by Universal, they have not upgraded the picture quality or audio from the 25th Anniversary set, all they have done is repackage the 25th anniversary and add a bonus disc of new content of which half of it is not even in HD but 480i standard definition. They have been very cunning here though, as I was one of the people apprehensive about buying this again. But then I saw they were releasing in digibook packaging and it was at a lower price to the flux capicitor set. Being a fan of digibooks and sucker I was I purchased it as I didn't see review of the set until it was too late. Basically this is not a digibook in the traditional sense i.e a 32 or 64 page book with behind the scenes info but essentially a bunch of cardboard pages where the sleeves of each page act as pocket pouches for holding the discs which you can remove easily. Previous extras are spread across the first 3 discs along with the films, the new bonus disc is a hit and miss affair with 7 new extras of which 3 are 1080p Full HD 1 1080i and the other 2 in 480i SD. They are as follows 2015 message from Doc Brown & new short in 1080p which is basically what he said at the end of the last movie and the new short film is somewhat pointless and boring 2015 commercials 1080p for Jaws 19 & Hoverboard, Outatime: Restoring the Delorean in 1080i which is only 1 of 2 worthy new extras. The other 2 being in 480i SD 2 episodes from the animated show couldn't they just upgraded this? being this is bluray & the 9 part Looking Back to the future from 2009 also SD when it should have been HD also portions of this doc just repeat what was said in previous 6 part doc. It does have nice cover art of all the films on the discs though. Now living in the UK I purchased the UK exclusive collectors tin 25th anniversary which in addition to the blurays had lots of memorabilia like the Grays sports Almanac, Lenticular McFly photo and more which was much better than this set. So I feel like a sucker for buying this again and won't be getting it again which they will probably release when it is 40 or 50 years. So if you have previous set this is not worth your time or money.

I can't give a full 5 stars until the Eric Stoltz footage from Back to the Future is finally released. I mean, COME ON! IT'S BEEN 30 YEARS! We deserve to see the holy grail of preserved film footage, the "what if" that every fan has wondered.
If you don't have a BD of this movie buy it, the sound & image quality are excellents for a upgrade from a 1985 movie

Absolutely love these films but the description / features aren't correct. It's very misleading because it only has 4 discs not 5.
I bought this box set because the UK version only has 4 discs, I thought I was getting something extra but it turns out that that was not the case.

I'm very disappointed that I've wasted money on an item I didn't need and also very disappointed 3 amazon customer service members assured me this came with 5 discs.

Even though, I love the films, I'm giving this a 1 star review because of the false description and poor service from Amazon.
It's old but it's entertaining.
Packaging could have been better, don't like how you have to slide the discs out of a book type case, it scratches the discs to easily.
Good and working condition, exactly what i wanted
Love this trilogy. Got a decent deal on the pre-release and having the digital copies was a bonus.
Thanks!
looks clear and coloerful in blu ray fast shipping

They did a great job on restoring these movies. The first one looks like the movie was filmed in the last year. The other two were really good except for special effects really showed their age. Maybe it was because the picture was just so crisp, but the special effects really do not hold up to the times in the last two films. This was well worth the money for it. I would say I would have happily paid 60 or 70 for this. The really did that great of a job. I have other bluray movies that are of 80's films and have thought many times that it looks about the same as a vhs film. Can't say that here at all. Just beautiful on my 60" LG 1080p 3D TV. Just gorgeous. Sounds awesome on the DTS system too. Really happy with this purchase.

Must have set for any home collection.  While this does add a few minor differences in the extras, generally speaking for the most part is same as 25th anniversary set so other than the novelty of this set being released on the future time travel destination date of the second , movie, might not  be worthwhile.  If however you don't have the 25th anniversary set, you will love this collection and we'll worth it.  For die hard fans, maybe collect both sets just giving warning the differences are minimal.
I love back to the future so happy it got here so quickly! 5 stars all the way!

If you own the 25th Anniversary set - then keep hold of it and don't upgrade with this. It's the same audio and picture transfer as the 25th Anniversary set with an extra disc of new bonus features. They're, so-so, but not worth spending more coin to get the upgraded set. A 4K transfer would have been a nice gesture for this historic franchise. Here's to hope, that Universal will do something special with the picture transfer in the future.

Blu-ray discs I received have artwork from each film on them. Cardboard packaging isn't as bad as the plastic trays that the 25th anniversary Blu-rays gave in and we're a pain to remove discs from.  Blu-ray  discs don'the scratch as easily ss DVDS. Sure it's a cash grab, but they included so much bonus material on the earlier discs that there wasn't much left to put on these. At least this didn't cost $88 for the crappy packaging and cheap Flux capacitor.
We have a blu-Ray player at home and it's just absolutely amazingly clear. So it's worth the money.

If you are even thinking of buying a copy of these movies in the year 2015, why not get this collector's version . . .

Anyone taking the time to read reviews on a DVD release for these dated but always classic films must be a fan, even if they don't realize it (yet). Save yourself some time and go for this special edition - the extras make this a great gift item too.

Those not really into BTTF as a cultural event may not appreciate the details, but then they would likely not be thinking of buying these movies at this stage.
I owned this classic trilogy in VHS as they became available. Now I have them back in Blue-ray.
An essential set in anyone's DVD collection. Love the packaging, and love the fact that not only do you have the Blu-Ray discs but you also have the digital copies to the movies.

A great package for $30 (at the time of release)!  If you have the 25th anniversary set, I would not spend money to double dip with this set unless you are a collector of Back to the Future -- which in this case you will buy it no matter what.  The discs are the exact same as the 25th anniversary, with the exception of an extra bonus disc.  The films look great, and I will wholeheartedly recommend this to anyone who does not have the trilogy or are looking to upgrade from a previous format!

This is the third edition I purchased. The original 3 disk set, the individual releases of the 3 films and this set. I did not buy the 25th anniversary edition because I know that there was going to be a 30th edition-and I further knew that it would come out in October of this year.

THE PACKAGING
One of the complaints in the other reviews is that the packaging is all cardboard and the discs are held in cardboard holder. Really? Then why did my copy come in a flipper disc plastic case? This is the DVD edition I got-not the Blu rays. Did the Blu rays come in a cardboard holder??

SPECIAL FEATURES
Since I don't have the 25th anniversary edition, I don't know what's in that and what's not. Much of the info contained in the interviews is pretty much the same as were the old ones on the other releases. However, it's a treat seeing Christopher Lloyd who was absent in the other DVDs. The 4th disc has all the other features that were on the 3 movie disks before. The 5th disk as I understand is all new.

THE FILMS
I haven't watched the films yet on this release-but if it's as good as the other releases-I'm happy.

As a huge fan of the Back to the Future movies it is great to have all three movies on Blu Ray and digital HD copies I can stream through my Roku. And to top it off there are a ton of extras and behind the scenes footage that I will be diving into.

The films are terrific but the discs are the SAME as the 25th Anniversary set!! Not kosher, Universal. I'm enjoying the much improved packaging, but I could have used the money to buy something that was not an almost-duplicate of the previous set. There IS an interesting blu-ray of extras, some new some not. Technically, the discs look good (as before, good, not great). I could not test sound properly last night but I'm sure it, like everything else on the three "film" discs, is the same.  Back to the Future 30th Anniversary Trilogy (Blu-ray + DIGITAL HD)

Love the films, but the all new short "Doc Brown Saves the World" would more accurately be called "Doc Brown says several of the most blase BTTF sentences you could have written." There is no world saving, and he doesn't even get out of the DeLorean, unlike in the teaser for the trailer...? Certainly not worth buying just for this new work, and that's what I did.
Don't listen to the ridiculous negative reviews, this is a great anniversary edition, I love it, if you're a fan of back to the future you will enjoy this 30th anniversary edition.
A+

My 10 yr old loved #1 and cant wait to watch the others.
All was good!
Great movies that take me back to my youth.
Best movie ever.  Blu Ray and Digital was a great deal
3 of my favorite movies! Introducing the trilogy to my kids has been a lot of fun! Great Scott!
